content.description:
Amazing route with varied climbing, i.e. crack, face, slab, runnel.

P1 - 5.9: Start up the short finger/hand crack on the starting block/bulge; leave the crack after a few moves once the crack turns 90 degrees right/horizontal; climb up face/slab, up a runnel, to the belay ledge (2 bolts, no rap rings/chains).

P2 - 5.6: Follow the obvious crack with large face holds along side, passing an anchor for another route. Make your way up and right eventually to reach large belay blocks.
content.protection: 9 bolts, plus 2 bolt anchor on p1. Pro to 3". 70m rope helps to reach a good belay on p2, but a 60m can just barely make it to the lowest belay blocks.
content.location: Near the middle of the wall. 2 routes left of Aqua Groovy, which has an obvious line of bolts up a thin edge/seem leading to a double runnel system). ID the start by looking for the 20 foot crack that makes a 90 degree right turn near its top. Walk off right.

content.description: Fun route with the crux at the 4th bolt.
content.protection: First pitch is all bolts, pro is needed to climb the route to the top, Some climb this route in 3 pitches.
content.location: It is the far right route.

content.description:
P1: Thin slab for several bolts to a vertical runnel. A series of 5.10 sections separated by a move or two of easier climbing. This pitch is full value at 55m and every move quality. Ends at a 2 bolt anchor with chains and a big ledge.

P2: Steep headwall through 3 bolts, made easier with good use of a leftward facing dihedral. After that there are large holds and the angle decreases significantly to the top.
content.protection: P1: 16 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor with chains, P2: 5 bolts. Great block at the top which takes .5, .75, and 1 for an easy anchor. 60 m rope is fine. Walk off to climber's right.
content.location: Left of Aqua Groovy and right of Burning Desire. Look for the large light colored triangle of slab at the beginning of the route. Also, it's littered with bolts.
